reviews.title: Museum pass covers this
reviews.text: Lovelymuseumdefinatelyworthatrip,and included in museum pass dont miss the unicorn tapestries

reviews.title: Mediaeval Treat
reviews.text: Marvellous old museum, full of mediaeval riches. Worth the journey just for the tapestry of the Lady and the Unicorn.

reviews.title: Best Medieval Museum in France
reviews.text: The Cluny is a masterpiece in itself. Everything from Visigothic crowns to relics of St. Thomas Becket are inside. The museum is built on a Roman Bath and the ruins on the lower level are wonderful. The Lady and the Unicorn tapestries are world reknown. Truly a must see museum in Paris.

reviews.title: The Lady with the Unicorn
reviews.text: 6 amazing tapestry panels depicting the 5 senses - and the moment after. Truly beautiful medieval works of art and worth a visit. The rest of the museum is OK and the building itself is fascinating, but I would make this a stop only if you have a Paris museum card and do it at the end of a walk through the St Germain neighborhood.

reviews.title: Gaston Februs
reviews.text: We all liked the illuminated manuscripts and the tapestries of the Lady and the Unicorn.

reviews.title: Great collection of medieval artefacts
reviews.text: Almost overwhelming collection in an interesting building. Entry currently 8.50 euros, free on the first Sunday of every month. Closed Tuesdays.

reviews.title: Very nice to go! Many artifacts!
reviews.text: What an interesting place to go! On sundays the tickets are free. Very nice museum about the middle age! Close to the Sorbonne.

reviews.title: Roman ruins in Paris!
reviews.text: Amazing collection of high chivalry and medieval art set upon the ruins of the Roman baths. This is a Paris Museum Pass site.

reviews.title: Great tapestries and Roman baths
reviews.text: Famous unicorn tapestries. Neat Roman baths in courtyard.

reviews.title: My least favorite of all the Paris Museums visited.
reviews.text: I have to admit that this was my least favorite museum that I visited while in Paris. Based on all of the great Trip Advisor reviews, I really tried to like it but….

reviews.title: For lovers of Middle ages...
reviews.text: I you go there on a quiet day (so many tourists and schools!) the most amazing collection of medieval... everything ! Plus the famous Tapestries of the Lady and the Unicorn (there is a book about their alchemical meaning and Message in English). Situated in a buiding of the Cluny monks of the XIIIth Century where, if you are interested in Druids too, you'll find the sign hidden in sculptures (left, outside): the Snail. Nothing to say : just watch !

reviews.title: Great Museum! Better than the Louvre???
reviews.text: This museum is small but packed with great, amazing objects that truly cover the Medieval Age. Set in an old abbey, across the street from the Sorbonne, it is not just home of the Lady and the Unicorn tapestries (which are huge, and a set of 6) but carvings from the front of Notre Dame that were ripped off in the late 1700s. Artwork, bronze age jewelry, a huge collection of reliquaries, Middle Eastern plates and European furniture.

reviews.title: Small, but worth it
reviews.text: Go early; I was there when the doors opened at 9:15 (closed on Tuesdays) and had the place to myself for about 40 minutes, when two school groups arrived. You have to leave a picture ID to use the audioguide and I did not do so. Toilets are right at the entrance/ticket desk. Gift shop is almost exclusively books....some in English, a great selection, didn't see them in the Louvre gift shops.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: Visit took about 1.5 hours without audio guide. Starbucks across the street, Monoprix if you want a snack.

reviews.title: very rich in "sacret art"
reviews.text: It's a very well-organised smaller museum with a nice collection, set in a beautiful environment and easy to access. It may not be the Louvre, but it's perfect for a morning out to feel the culture and see some very good displays.

reviews.title: Great Medieval Museum
reviews.text: Greatly enjoyed the tapestries and large spaces. Was quite surprised by how much was actually behind the front door.

reviews.title: A special treasure!
reviews.text: Allow plenty of time to experience this gem. There is most always a special show as well. The entrance is a bit hard to find for some, but do not give up!

reviews.title: The most medieval art I've seen in one place!
reviews.text: For any fan of the medieval era, Cluny is a must see. Lots and lots of medieval art, and only medieval art. If I had one criticism it would be a lack of daily objects.

reviews.title: Excellent collection of medieval artifacts
reviews.text: Extensive collection of sculptures, gold and silver religious objects, and tapestries housed in the Hotel de Cluny. Don't miss the Lady with Unicorn Tapestries.

reviews.title: Nice, no crowds
reviews.text: fascinating museum in an abbey setting. Great tapestry collection of the lady and the unicorn. Many nice ornaments.

name: Musee National du Moyen Age-Thermes et Hotel de Cluny
